thread.title: Lego Tape Is Coming, and It’s Surprisingly Inexpensive - It turns anything (even walls!) into a Lego-friendly surface
thread.title_full: Lego Tape Is Coming, and It’s Surprisingly Inexpensive - It turns anything (even walls!) into a Lego-friendly surface

author: RetailMeNot Editors
title: Lego Tape Is Coming, and It’s Surprisingly Inexpensive - It turns anything (even walls!) into a Lego-friendly surface
text:
About Us Home + Garden DIY Goodness Go to RetailMeNot ›› Sign Up Log In Lego Tape Is Coming, and It’s Surprisingly Inexpensive It turns anything (even walls!) into a Lego-friendly surface Lego Tape Is Coming, and It’s Surprisingly Inexpensive It turns anything (even walls!) into a Lego-friendly surface 
How has it taken this long for Lego -friendly tape to become a thing? This is genius. Not only does it allow for kids and adults alike to have even more fun playing with the bricks, but because the tape is slightly squishy, it practically eliminates the fear of stepping on the dang things. Just take our money now. 
Nimuno Loops is the name of the project, which is currently being crowdfunded on the site Indiegogo—pre-order two 6.5-foot rolls starting at $11 (estimated delivery in July). The tape works with standard-size Legos, Mega Bloks, Kreo and “most major toy building block systems.” It’s incredibly flexible, can be cut into any shape, and you can reposition it and stick it on virtually anything. See Nimuno Loops in Action Below
